Module it.polimi.ingsw.PSP47
Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP47.Model.Gods

Class God

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP47.Model.Gods.God
Direct Known Subclasses:
Apollo, Artemis, Athena, Atlas, Chronus, Demeter, Hephaestus, Hera, Hestia, Minotaur, Pan, Prometheus, Triton, Zeus
public abstract class God
extends java.lang.Object
This class is a skeleton to be implemented when gods are added. When a god (as subclass) is created, every field MUST be initialized. Otherwise, the game may not work correctly.

  • Method Details

    • getMIN_BUILDINGS

      public int getMIN_BUILDINGS()
      Returns:
      the minimum amount of buildings to be constructed by a god

    • getMAX_MOVEMENTS

      public int getMAX_MOVEMENTS()
      Returns:
      the maximum amount of movements to be done by a god

    • getMAX_BUILDINGS

      public int getMAX_BUILDINGS()
      Returns:
      the maximum amount of buildings to be constructed by a god

    • canAlwaysBuildDome

      public boolean canAlwaysBuildDome()
      Returns:
      if the god is allowed to build dome at any level

    • threePlayersGame

      public boolean threePlayersGame()
      Returns:
      if the card is available in a three players game

    • move

      public boolean move​(Direction direction, Worker worker) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException, InvalidMoveException, InvalidDirectionException
      This method moves a Worker from a Slot to another, towards the destination specified.
      Parameters:
      direction - where the worker wants to move to.
      worker - the Player's Worker to be moved.
      Returns:
      true if the worker moved voluntarily up on the third level, false otherwise
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the worker try to move in a direction that is out out the board
      InvalidDirectionException - if there are some troubles of I/O.
      InvalidMoveException - if the move is invalid.

    • build

      public void build​(Direction direction, Worker worker) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException, InvalidBuildException, InvalidDirectionException
      This method builds a construction on the Slot adjacent to the Worker in the direction chosen.
      Parameters:
      direction - specifies the slot where to build
      worker - one of the player's workers
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the worker try to build in a direction that is out out the board
      InvalidDirectionException - if there are problems with I/O
      InvalidBuildException - if building is not permitted.

    • resetParameters

      public void resetParameters()
      Reset all the additional eventual parameters of the god. It has to be called inside the god and it's not necessary for every god.

    • checkIfCanMove

      public boolean checkIfCanMove​(Worker worker)
      Parameters:
      worker - Player's Worker selected to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if it's possible to move,false otherwise.

    • checkIfCanBuild

      public boolean checkIfCanBuild​(Worker worker)
      See checkIfCanGoOn(Worker)
      Parameters:
      worker - Player's Worker selected to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if it's possible to build, false otherwise.

    • checkIfCanMoveInNormalConditions

      protected final boolean checkIfCanMoveInNormalConditions​(Worker worker)
      See checkIfCanGoOn(Worker) This method is a way not to repeat for each god the same check in case they don't modify the normal conditions.
      Parameters:
      worker - Player's Worker selected to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if it's possible to move in normal conditions, false otherwise.

    • checkIfCanBuildInNormalConditions

      protected final boolean checkIfCanBuildInNormalConditions​(Worker worker)
      See checkIfCanGoOn(Worker) This method is a way not to repeat for each god the same check, in the case them don't modify the normal conditions.
      Parameters:
      worker - Player's Worker selected to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if it's possible to build in normal conditions, false otherwise.

    • checkIfCanGoOn

      public boolean checkIfCanGoOn​(Worker worker)
      This method checks, using checkIfCanBuild(Worker), checkIfCanMove(Worker), checkIfCanBuildInNormalConditions(Worker) and checkIfCanMoveInNormalConditions(Worker), can understand if the worker chosen can go on doing something or they're blocked.
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker chosen to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if the worker can go on, false otherwise.

    • checkIfAWorkerIsOnSlot

      public boolean checkIfAWorkerIsOnSlot​(Slot slot)
      This method checks if the slot is occupied by a worker.
      Parameters:
      slot - the slot that has to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the slot is occupied by a worker, false otherwise.

    • checkIfAWorkerIsOnSlot

      public boolean checkIfAWorkerIsOnSlot​(Slot slot, Direction direction)
      This method checks if the slot is occupied. It's useful for building.
      Parameters:
      slot - the slot to be checked.
      direction - the direction where to build with respect to the previous slot.
      Returns:
      true if the slot is occupied, false otherwise.

    • checkOrderOfActions

      public boolean checkOrderOfActions​(Action action)
      It returns true if the order of actions is uncorrected, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      action - the action to compute.
      Returns:
      true if the order of actions is uncorrected, false otherwise.

    • validateEndTurn

      public boolean validateEndTurn()
      This method controls if the player can end his turn. If the player is winning, it returns true.
      Returns:
      true if the player can end his turn, false otherwise.

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Returns:
      the name of the god.
